H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H1818.def: = red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and animals; ► used in rituals such as sacrifices, purification and covenant ceremonies, and never to be eaten; ≈ regarded as the seat of {L:life<SDBH:נֶפֶשׁ>}; human blood, when flowing from the body, pollutes the body and the land

H3585.def: = state of having lost body volume

H4392.def: = state in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H4185.def: = process why which an object gets detached from the place where it has been fixed

H2964.def: literally: what is torn apart; hence: = slain victim of a carnivorous animal; ≈ associated with a violent death, bloodshed, and frequently used as a metaphor for victims of warfare

H7752.def: = strip of leather or length of cord fastened to a handle, ► used for beating a person or urging on an animal

H212.def: = ring or round disk with a rod (axle) running through its center or hub; either made as a solid piece of wood or a central hub connected with several spokes to an outher rim; ◄ made of wood and sometimes partly of iron; ► used to help vehicles move over the ground, and occasionally for other purposes, such as threshing grain

H1725.def: = action by which a horse walks at a fast pace, with all the feet off the ground together in each stride

H5483.def: = large domesticated solid-hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot

H7540.def: = action with which humans or animals move in a quick and light or lively way

H4818.def: = open vehicle with two or four wheels, pulled by one or more horses; ◄ made or wood and iron; ► used in war or for travelling

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H2719.def: = sharp object; ◄ made out of iron or flint; ► used as tool for various purposes

H1300.def: = process by which bright flashes of light are seen between clouds and the ground or within clouds, often accompanied by thunder; ≈ regarded as fire from heaven and arrows or spears from God

H2595.def: = a long, straight rod, usually made of wood, with a sharp {L:iron<SDBH:בַּרְזֶל>} head or point; used for piercing by thrusting; its length varied from the height of a man to much longer

H2491.def: = state in which humans or animal are fatally wounded with a sharp object

H3514.def: = state in which objects are relatively heavy

H6297.def: = body of an animal or human that has died or been killed; ► source of pollution and impurity

H1472.def: = the physical structure, including the bones, flesh, and organs, of a person or animal, either alive or dead

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H3782.def: = process by which humans trip or temporarily lose their balance when walking; ≈ often used figuratively to denote failure

H2183.def: = action by which humans engage in prostitution; ≈ associated with unfaithfulness

H2580.def: = state in which someone or something is physically attractive; ► which may bring about a favorable attitude in others

H1172.def: = female person in charge of another person, animal, or inanimate object

H3785.def: = action by which humans make an effort to gain control over humans, animals, or deities ◄ through rituals and incantations

H4376.def: = causative action by which humans hand over objects or privileges in their possession in exchange for goods or money

H4940.def: = a particular group or class of either people (as in a clan or tribe) or animals (as in a genus or species) that share common characteristics

H5002.def: = action by which humans or deities make a prophetic statement; in the case of a deity this is usually done through the mouth of a prophet or seer

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6635.def: = state of being in the service of the community; ≈ sometimes associated with suffering and heavy labor

H1540.def: = action by which someone takes off his/her clothes, either entirely or in part, ► as a result of which that person becomes naked or improperly dressed, ≈ which is considered a shameful thing to do

H7757.def: = the part of a coat or dress that hangs below the waist

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H4626.def: = the space on a surface that has no decorations

H7036.def: = state which provokes disdain from the general public or from a specific category of people ◄ due to one's behavior or condition

H4467.def: = state in which a person or deity has been entrusted with the office of {L:king<SDBH:מֶלֶךְ>} or {L:queen<SDBH:מַלְכָּה>}

H8251.def: = an object that is regarded as unclean and therefore treated as utterly detestable

H5034.def: = process by which plants and their products become devoid of moisture, and therefore lose color and bend over ► which may ultimately result in death if circumstances do not change; ≈ associated with drought and destruction, often as punishment from God

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H7210.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H5074.def: = action by which humans or animals move away in haste from a certain place ► in order to escape from a situation that is considered dangerous

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H5210.def: = town; ◄ located in northern Mesopotamia near Mosul on the east bank of the {L:Tigris<SDBH:חִדֶּקֶל>}; ► built by {L:Nimrod<SDBH:נִמְרֹד>} after the {L:flood<SDBH:מַבּוּל>}; ancient capital of {L:Assyria<SDBH:אַשּׁוּר>}, preached against by the prophet {L:Jonah<SDBH:יֹונָה>}

H7703.def: = action by which humans or wild animals attack other humans and kill, destroy and steal in the process

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H5110.def: = process by which objects shake or move back and forth ◄ because of being unstable or when agitated by an outside force

H370.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H1245.def: = action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

H5162.def: = causative action by which humans or deities seek to make (other) humans feel relief after a time of grief, anxiety, or fear

H3190.def: = causative action by which humans cause objects to be in a better state of maintenance than before

H4996.def: = town, commonly known as Thebes; ◄ located in {L:Egypt<SDBH:מִצְרַיִם>}; ► center of worship of {L:Amon<SDBH:אָמֹון>}

H528.def: = person with skills for a specific craft

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H2975.def: = a river ◄ flowing through Egypt from south to north; ► overflowing its banks each year and providing fertility for the fields on both sides; ≈ generally associated with Egypt's power and prosperity

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H2426.def: meaning unsure; probably: = a structure surrounding a town, outside the main wall; ◄ made out of of stones or bricks; ► provides strength and security to the town; ≈ sometimes used metaphorically to denote someone who offers protection

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H2346.def: = structure surrounding a building, a collection of buildings, or a town; ◄ made out of stone; ► provides protection; ≈ associated with strength, safety, and the ability to resist attacks from outside

H3568.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Ham<SDBH:חָם>}; ► regarded as ancestor of the {L:Cushites<SDBH:כּוּשִׁי>}

H4714.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Ham<SDBH:חָם>}; ► regarded as founder of the {L:Egyptian<SDBH:מִצְרִי>} nation

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H6109.def: = state in which humans have physical, political, or military strength

H6316.def: = ethnic group; ◄ regarded as descendants of {L:Ham<SDBH:חָם>}, son of {L:Noah<SDBH:נֹחַ>}

H3864.def: = land and ethnic group ◄ located west of {L:Egypt<SDBH:מִצְרַיִם>}; ► often fighting in Egyptian army

H5833.def: = action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans (in both military and non-military contexts) ► in order to make their life or work or task easier

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H1473.def: = causative action by which a group of people is forced to leave their country to settle somewhere else for an indefinite amount of time

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H2351.def: = referent to the location outside of an object

H3032.def: = action by which an object is caused to move from someone's hands toward a surface or place nearby

H1486.def: = specially marked object, such as a pebble or piece of pottery, ► used in order to decide questions

H3513.def: = state in which objects have relatively much weight, ≈ which is often associated with slowness, functioning with difficulty, but also with importance, riches, status, etc.

H7576.def: = causative action by which humans tie (part of) the body of (other) humans or animals with a {L:chain<SDBH:רַתֹּוק>} ► in order to keep them under control

H2131.def: = chains or shackles attached to the feet of a captive ► in order to restrain their movements

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H1245.def: = action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

H4581.def: = large fortification; for the defense of a town; built of stone; could consist of one extra strong building or of a complex of buildings surrounded by its own strong wall; ≈ associated with protection and security and often used as an epithet for God

H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H4013.def: = area that has been fortified with the help of a strong and solid wall and possibly other defense works; ≈ associated with security

H8384.def: = a tree that reaches a height of 5-8 m, with a round crown and very deep roots; its fruit is about the size of a hen’s egg and can be green, yellow, purple, or brown depending on the type; ◄ Ficus carica; ► the fruits are sweet and soft; ≈ the image of peace and happiness in Israel was: “every man under his vine and under his fig tree"

H1061.def: = the earliest agricultural outcomes of the season; ► with an important function in the religious offerings system; ≈ often with a religious connotation

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H5128.def: = process by which objects move up and down or sideways

H5307.def: = process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H802.def: = woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H6605.def: = process by which objects open up ► in order to give access to something located inside or to create a passage

H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H784.def: = state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H1280.def: a long rigid piece of wood, metal, or similar material, attached in horizontal position to a construction to give it strength and stability

H7579.def: = causative action by which humans let down a bucket-like container attached to a rope into a well in order to draw water from it

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H4692.def: = state of severe sorrow or anguish

H2388.def: = state in which humans or deities are strong in a physical, political, or military sense, or simply in their ability to convince others with words

H4013.def: = area that has been fortified with the help of a strong and solid wall and possibly other defense works; ≈ associated with security

H2916.def: = wet soil;◄ moistened by rain or because of its proximity to a body of water; ► can be used for pottery or bricks; ≈ regarded as cheap, easily obtainable and workable material for making basic items; otherwise as a valueless substance or an obstacle for movement

H7429.def: = action by which humans, deities, or animals tread heavily and noisily on people, plants, or objects; ► usually with the purpose of killing, destroying, desecrating, and/or humiliating

H2563.def: = stiff tenacious earth; ► material of which bricks, pottery, and even man himself is made; ≈ buildings made with this material are regarded as relatively weak as opposed to buildings made of stone; therefore it is also seen as relatively worthless material

H4404.def: exact meaning unknown: = small, rectangular wooden container (about 20‑25 by 10 centimeters) ► used to form bricks in equal sizes; or: = large outdoor oven ► for baking bricks to harden them

H784.def: = state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H2719.def: = sharp object; ◄ made out of iron or flint; ► used as tool for various purposes

H3772.def: = causative action by which humans use a knife or another sharp implement to remove something from a larger object

H3218.def: term found primarily in poetic contexts: = six-legged, winged insect that is characterized by the fact that its third pair of legs is elongated and adapted to hopping; insects of this type move in swarms at certain periods and migrate to new areas, which they colonize; at other times they live either solitary or in small groups; ◄ Acrididae family; ► normally eaten cooked by toasting, grilling, frying, or broiling, though in some places they are also eaten raw

H3513.def: = state in which objects have relatively much weight, ≈ which is often associated with slowness, functioning with difficulty, but also with importance, riches, status, etc.

H697.def: = six-legged, winged insect that is characterized by the fact that its third pair of legs is elongated and adapted to hopping; insects of this type move in swarms at certain periods and migrate to new areas, which they colonize; at other times they live either solitary or in small groups; ◄ Acrididae family; ► normally eaten cooked by toasting, grilling, frying, or broiling, though in some places they are also eaten raw; clean animal, that may be eaten

H3556.def: = celestial body, providing light, and assisting the sun and moon in ruling day and night; ◄ created and controled by the divine; ≈ associated with a high and elevated position and sometimes personified as creatures that can sing and wage war

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H3218.def: term found primarily in poetic contexts: = six-legged, winged insect that is characterized by the fact that its third pair of legs is elongated and adapted to hopping; insects of this type move in swarms at certain periods and migrate to new areas, which they colonize; at other times they live either solitary or in small groups; ◄ Acrididae family; ► normally eaten cooked by toasting, grilling, frying, or broiling, though in some places they are also eaten raw

H6584.def: meaning unsure; possibly: = process by which a locust sheds its skin

H5774.def: = process by which an object moves through the air

16.gl: to advance upon (an area or people)

H697.def: = six-legged, winged insect that is characterized by the fact that its third pair of legs is elongated and adapted to hopping; insects of this type move in swarms at certain periods and migrate to new areas, which they colonize; at other times they live either solitary or in small groups; ◄ Acrididae family; ► normally eaten cooked by toasting, grilling, frying, or broiling, though in some places they are also eaten raw; clean animal, that may be eaten

H2951.def: = one responsible for overseeing and/or reporting on the activities of others, in an organized network; ◄ perhaps derived from the Assyrian word for "tablet writer"

H1462.def: = six-legged, winged insect that is characterized by the fact that its third pair of legs is elongated and adapted to hopping; insects of this type move in swarms at certain periods and migrate to new areas, which they colonize; at other times they live either solitary or in small groups; ◄ Acrididae family; ► normally eaten cooked by toasting, grilling, frying, or broiling, though in some places they are also eaten raw; clean animal, that may be eaten; ≈ associated with large quantities and destruction

H2583.def: = state in which an individual or group of people dwells at a certain location for a limited period of time and often for a specific purpose

H7135.def: = referring to a state of low temperature

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H8121.def: = celestial body ► that marks day and night and produces warmth and light for the earth

H2224.def: = process by which the sun appears in the morning to provide light and warmth to the world; ≈ associated with a new period of well-being

H5074.def: = action by which humans or animals move away in haste from a certain place ► in order to escape from a situation that is considered dangerous

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H4725.def: = a specific area or point in space

H335.def: = referent to an unknown location; ► normally used with the purpose of finding which location that is; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that such a location cannot be found

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H804.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Shem<SDBH:שֵׁם>}; ► regarded as founder of Assyria

H7462.def: = action by which animals are feeding on grass and other edible materials in the field, ≈ often extended to denote the way a king cares for his subjects or the way God cares for his people

H5123.def: = state in which humans or animals are in a state of a relatively light sleep; ≈ sometimes associated with death, sometimes with being inactive

H117.def: = pertaining to inspiring awe and respect ◄ because of one's beauty, size, strength, or status

H6335.def: = action by which animals bring down their foot heavily on the ground or some other object

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H6908.def: = action by which humans or animals come together as a group for a common purpose

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H3545.def: literally: weakening; hence: = process by which a condition gradually loses its intensity

H7667.def: = causative action or process by which humans or deities cause an object to be broken into two or more pieces; ≈ sometimes use figuratively to denote the sudden end of a certain condition or situation

H4347.def: = area of physical damage on the body; ◄ caused by an act of aggression

H2470.def: = process by which humans lose their physical strength ◄ as a result of sickness, injury, a prolonged exertion of strength, or other circumstances

H3709.def: = the inner part of the human {L:hand<SDBH:יָד>}, but with special focus on the activities performed with it, such as holding, covering, or lifting objects, leaning on a staff, clapping, etc.

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

22.gl: to clap (one's) hands (for joy or glee)
